citation.article-title: Friedmanniella spumicola sp. nov. and Friedmanniella capsulata sp. nov. from activated sludge foam: gram-positive cocci that grow in aggregates of repeating groups of cocci.

p.s: Description of Friedmanniella capsulata sp. nov.
Friedmanniella capsulata (cap.su.la'ta. L. fem. adj. capsuluta capsulated)
This species is characterized by a bright orange colour when grown in both solid and liquid media.
It also can store polyphosphate aerobically.
The pH range for growth is 5.5-7.5, with an optimal growth pH of 6.5-7.0.

It utilizes L-rhamnose, maltose, sucrose, Œ≤-cyclodextrin, L-fucose, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glucose 6-phosphate, maltotriose, sedoheptulosan, stachyose, D-tagatose, lactamide, 2'deoxyadenosine, Œ±-ketoglutaric acid, propionic acid, succinamic acid, 3-methylglucose, bromosuccinic acid, glucuronamide, D-alanine, L-alanyl glycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, glycyl-L-aspartic acid, L-histidine, hydroxy-L-proline, L-threonine, DL-carnitine, ùõæ-aminobutyric acid, uroconic acid, inosine, D-melezitose, malate and trypsin.
The following substrates are not utilized: i-erythritol, D-saccharic acid, formic acid, adonitol, D-galactose, D-psicose, turanose, methyl-pyruvate, Œ±-keto butyric acid, alaninamide and thymidine.
Cellular fatty acids are characterized by the presence of i-C16:0 (14-methylpentadecanoic acid), i-C17:0 (15-methylhexadecanoic acid) and ai-C17:0 (14-methylhexadecanoic acid).
It also contains MK-9(H4) and MK-9(H2) and is characterized by the presence of MK-7(H4).
The G + C content is 74 mol%.
The type strain, strain Ben 108T, has been deposited in the Australian Collection of Microorganisms, as strain ACM 5120T.
